page.title: 09Macc. Forest - Home Life
page.content:
HOME LIFE
The residents enjoy most of the facilities that town dwellers would with the exception of gas, mains sewage and water. The water is from private bore holes and springs which occasionally dry up in the summer. There are no shops or deliveries and very little public transport. There is a summer bus service which passes through the area several times a week. The children travel long distances to school, the school bus picking them up early in the morning thus making a long day. The village school closed 20 years ago.
The women are very capable homemakers and the families are community minded.
